result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:43 PM Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Court reviews history of case.  Court notes counsel report.  Def. wants an attorney. Court finds def. right to have an attorney and finds good cause to go past time limits for P.H.  State is in compliance with victim rights. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:43 PM Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted the PD office and is still awaiting counsel. Def. qualifies for counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No controlled substances without prescription
Take medication as prescribed. 
Def. must contact Public Defender office within 7 days.

2:19 PM Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. will apply for P.D. State is in compliance with victim rights. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and Take any medications as prescribed. State gives bail bond recommendation. Def. heard on bond.  Court orders $650 cash bond, already posted with conditions No controlled substances without prescription, Take medication as prescribed. Def. must contact Public Defender office within 7 days. Def. makes statement.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
